title: 1D kinematics - car B catches up to car A

content.question: Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is traveling to the right at a constant velocity <math alttext="v sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, it passes Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, which is at rest. At the same time (<math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>), Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> begins to accelerate with a constant acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="lowercase a sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> has a velocity of <math alttext="v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> when it reaches the same position as Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> at time <math alttext="t equals t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following, if any, is an expression for the time it takes for Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> to catch up to Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub A, and denominator lowercase a sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>a</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 v sub A, and denominator lowercase a sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 v sub A, end sub, squared, and denominator lowercase a sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>
It cannot be determined without knowing the distance traveled by the cars.

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 v sub A, and denominator lowercase a sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
